notes.text:
An update for ipa is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Identity Management (IdM) is a centralized authentication, identity management, and authorization solution for both traditional and cloud-based enterprise environments.

Security Fix(es):

* ipa: user can obtain a hash of the passwords of all domain users and perform offline brute force (CVE-2024-3183)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Use of Password Hash With Insufficient Computational Effort

notes.text:
A vulnerability was found in FreeIPA in a way when a Kerberos TGS-REQ is encrypted using the clientâs session key. This key is different for each new session, which protects it from brute force attacks. However, the ticket it contains is encrypted using the target principal key directly. For user principals, this key is a hash of a public per-principal randomly-generated salt and the userâs password.

If a principal is compromised it means the attacker would be able to retrieve tickets encrypted to any principal, all of them being encrypted by their own key directly. By taking these tickets and salts offline, the attacker could run brute force attacks to find character strings able to decrypt tickets when combined to a principal salt (i.e. find the principalâs password).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freeipa: user can obtain a hash of the passwords of all domain users and perform offline brute force
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This kind of attacks primarily affect user principals, not service principals because their keys are usually generated randomly. But weak user passwords are particularly vulnerable to such attacks, especially if they are referenced in password dictionaries.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
To mitigate this vulnerability, ticket requests to user principals are now disallowed in FreeIPA realms by default. This will keep attackers from obtaining data encrypted with the user key directly.

vulnerabilities.title: freeipa: user can obtain a hash of the passwords of all domain users and perform offline brute force
